intro: Conyza muliensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in clusters. Conyza muliensis is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
